1:
So now, Job, I beg you, hear my speech;\q listen to all my words.
\q
2:
See now, I have opened my mouth;\q my tongue has spoken in my mouth.
\q
3:
My words come from the uprightness of my heart;\q my lips speak pure knowledge.


\q
4:
The Spirit of God has made me;\q the breath of the Almighty has given me life.
\q
5:
If you can, answer me;\q set your words in order before me and stand up.


\q
6:
See, I am just as you are in God's sight;\q I also have been formed out of the clay.
\q
7:
See, terror of me will not make you afraid;\q neither will my pressure be heavy upon you.
\m


\q
8:
You have certainly spoken in my hearing;\q I have heard the sound of your words saying,
\q
9:
'I am clean and without transgression;\q I am innocent, and there is no sin in me.


\q
10:
See, God finds opportunities to attack me;\q he regards me as his enemy.
\q
11:
He puts my feet in stocks;\q he watches all my paths.'
\q
12:
See, in this you are not right—I will answer you,\q for God is greater than man.
\m


\q
13:
Why do you struggle against him?\q He does not account for any of his doings.
\q
14:
For God speaks once—\q yes, twice, though man does not notice it.
\q
15:
In a dream, in a vision of the night,\q when deep sleep falls upon men,
\q in slumber on the bed—


\q
16:
then God opens the ears of men,\q and frightens them with threats,
\q
17:
in order to pull man back from his sinful purposes,\q and keep pride from him.
\q
18:
God keeps man's life back from the pit,\q his life from crossing over to death.
\m


\q
19:
Man is punished also with pain on his bed,\q with constant agony in his bones,
\q
20:
so that his life abhors food,\q and his soul abhors delicacies.


\q
21:
His flesh is consumed away so that it cannot be seen;\q his bones, once not seen, now stick out.
\q
22:
Indeed, his soul draws close to the pit,\q his life to those who wish to destroy it.
\m


\q
23:
But if there is an angel who can be a mediator for him,\q a mediator, one from among the thousands of angels,
\q to show him what is right to do,
\q
25:
then his flesh will become fresher than a child's;\q he will return to the days of his youthful strength.
\q
26:
He will pray to God, and God will be kind to him,\q so that he sees God's face with joy.
\q God will give the person his triumph.

\q
27:
Then that person will sing in front of other people and say,\q 'I sinned and perverted that which was right,
\q but my sin was not punished.
\q
28:
God has rescued my soul from going down into the pit;\q my life will continue to see light.'
\m


\q
29:
See, God does all these things with a person,\q twice, yes, even three times,
\q
30:
to bring his soul back from the pit,\q so that he may be enlightened with the light of life.


\q
31:
Pay attention, Job, and listen to me;\q be silent and I will speak.
\q
32:
If you have anything to say, answer me;\q speak, for I wish to prove that you are in the right.
\q
33: If not, then listen to me;\q remain silent, and I will teach you wisdom."
